message.content:
cs.DB, cs.HC, cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.CY 

This paper discusses the implementation of hybrid human/computer systems for query processing, which involves incorporating crowdsourcing for data gathering and other tasks. This topic is most closely related to the sub-category of database systems (cs.DB), as the paper addresses fundamental issues in query semantics and query execution in such systems. The paper also discusses the challenges of monitoring query progress in crowdsourcing systems, which relates to the sub-category of human-computer interaction (cs.HC). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of statistical tools for reasoning about tradeoffs between time/cost and completeness, which is relevant to the sub-categories of information retrieval (cs.IR) and social and information networks (cs.SI). Finally, the paper touches on the topic of cybersecurity (cs.CY), as it discusses the need for secure and reliable crowdsourcing platforms.
